intro: Caucaea pichinchae, commonly known as the Pichincha caucaea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
